title: Yumu language (Nigeria)
text:
Yumu is a minor <a href="Kainji%20language">Kainji language</a> of <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>. It is listed as a potential <a href="Kambari%20language">Kambari language</a> by <a href="Roger%20Blench">Roger Blench</a>, however it does not have an "<a href="Ethnologue">Ethnologue</a>" nor <a href="Glottolog">Glottolog</a> entry.
The village of Yumu, said to be "of obscure origin", is located on the western side of <a href="Kainji%20Lake">Kainji Lake</a> in <a href="Agwara">Agwara</a> District, <a href="Niger%20State">Niger State</a>, adjacent to the areas of the divergent Kainji languages of <a href="Reshe%20language">Reshe</a>, <a href="Lopa%20language">Lopa</a> and <a href="Laru%20language">Laru</a>.
A 1979 linguistic survey of Nigeria, citing Rev. A. Washbrook, lists Yumu as either a dialect of Lopa or of Kambari.
